Candidate :  Simona Maassen  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
  
Location:   Netherlands  - Maastricht  
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
European Master's Degree in Human Rights and Democratization  1998 -1999  
University of Padova (Italy) and University Robert Schuman, Institut des Hautes Etudes Européennes, 
Strasbourg (France)  
European Legal Studies (European and international law)  1993 -1996 University of Maastricht  
Faculty of Law, Faculty of Political Science (EU exchange program)  1995 -1996 Universiteit of Florence 
(Italy)  
Master’s degree in Dutch Law  1991 -1997 University of Maastricht  
 
Languages  
Dutch  (Fluent )  
English (Fluent)  
Italian  
French  
Romanian  
 
 
CARE ER SUMMARY  
 
2007 -current SABIC  
Position: Manager Public Affairs  
Responsibilities:  
• Develop Public Affairs agenda and priorities  
• Develop and implement PA strategy  
• Internal alignment on positions and draft position papers  
• Compose and lead issue teams  
• Representation towards EU, national and regional governmental and political stakeholders  
• Advise and support senior management an d leadership in external high - level contacts  
• Development of intranet including Issue Management System  
• Advise on external communication  
• Setting up of Brussels office  
• Development of external networks at all government/ political levels  
 
2006 -2010  and 2018 -2022 City Council Maastricht  
Responsibilities:  
• Economic affairs  
  
2002 -2007 VNO -NCW  
Position: Advisor EU Affairs  
Responsibilities:  
• Representation at EU institutions and trade associations  
• Advise and support VNO -NCW member companies and Board  
• Development of external networks with policymakers, politicians and national media  
• Spokesperson  
 
1999 -2002 European Parliament  
Position: Policy Assistant to Toine Manders MEP  
Responsibilities:  
• Advise and support on parliamentary decision –making procedures  
• Analyse draft legislation and political issues  
• Writing articles, presentations, press releases etc.  
 
1999 NL Permanent Representation to the  Council of Europe  
Position: Personal Assistant to the Ambassador  
Responsibilities:  
• Preparation of meetings of the Committee of Ministers to the Council of Europe  
• Analyze political developments in the field of human rights and democratization  
 
1998 European Inst itute of Public Administration (EIPA)  
Position: Research Assistant  
Responsibilities:  
• Comparative research on EU accession progress of the candidate Member States  
 
1997 Ministry for Foreign Affairs  
Position: Internship  
Preparation of the International Treaty on the Suppression of Terrorist Bombings (United Nations)  
 
Other activit ies 
2003 -currently Guest speaker at trade associations, Ministry for Economic Affairs, training and 
research institutes  
2000 -2005 Board member NL liberal political party VVD in Brussels  
2004 Co - founder Alumni association Belgium University of Maastricht  
2000-2002 Organization of political debates in the European Parliament  
 
 
COMMENT  
 
Informatics And Technical Abilities  
• Hardware Knowledge: Outstanding.  
• Operating Systems Knowl edge: Windows, Linux,  Macintosh, DOS, Android.  
• Software Knowledge: Very good (MS Office, Openoffice, Lotus123, Origin).  
• Chemical Software Knowledge: Very good (Spectrum, ChemDrow, Panalytical X’pert, MDL 
ISIS, GC Chemstation, CASA XPS).  
 • Technical abilities : Synthesis and ch aracterization of organic and inorganic catalytic materials. 
Design, set -up and management of chemical lab scale plants for dangerous substances and 
chemical reactions in gas phase.  
• Management and servicing of analytical equipment (e.g.: HPLC, GC, TPR -O-D, GC -MS, IR, 
UV-Vis, Raman, XPS).  
 
For further information please contact Jan Johnston or Julie Smith  on 01695 5 70 6 96 or email 
julie.smith @johnston -vere.co.uk

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
